greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of phi*Pi, where phi = (1+sqrt(5))/2.
comment: The area of a golden ellipse with a semi-major axis phi and a minor semi-axis 1. - _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 05 2020
phi*Pi = area of the region having boundaries y = 0, x = Pi/2, and y = (tan x)^(4/5). - _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 25 2020
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
formula: Equals the nested radical sqrt(Pi^2+sqrt(Pi^4+sqrt(Pi^8+...))). For a proof, see A094885. - _Stanislav Sykora_, May 24 2016
Equals Integral_{x=0..Pi/2} tan(x)^(4/5) dx. - _Clark Kimberling_, Nov 18 2020
mathematica: First@ RealDigits[N[GoldenRatio Pi, 120]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 24 2016 *)
program: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); phi=(1+sqrt(5))/2; x=phi*Pi; for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b094886.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Apr 27 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 15 2004
